author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Chayime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These six things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu aguttadvāratā, bhojane amattaññutā—
segments.en: They relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They don’t guard the sense doors, and they eat too much.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These six things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Chayime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, na saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā—
segments.en: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They guard the sense doors, and they don’t eat too much.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”
